alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Western Clay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 6:09PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Bradford, northeastern Alachua and northwestern Clay Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 609 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Keystone Heights, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Starke, Keystone Heights, Middleburg, Oakleaf Plantation, Camp Blanding, Kingsley, Sampson, Waldo, Penney Farms and Lawtey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
